The popular name of other vegetable seeds or fruits, more or less resembling true beans

bean caper.definition: A deciduous plant of warm climates, generally with fleshy leaves and flowers of a yellow or whitish yellow color, of the genus Zygophyllum

bean trefoil.definition: A leguminous shrub of southern Europe, with trifoliate leaves (Anagyris foetida)

beanbag.definition: a small cloth bag filled with dried beans; it is thrown from person to person in games

beanball.definition: a baseball deliberately thrown at the batter's head

beaner.definition: a baseball deliberately thrown at the batter's head

beanfeast.definition: (British) an annual dinner party given by an employer for the employees

beanie.definition: a small skullcap; formerly worn by schoolboys and college freshmen

beano.definition: a game in which numbered balls are drawn and random and players cover the correponding numbers on their cards

bear.definition: To support or sustain; to hold up
To support and remove or carry; to convey
To conduct; to bring; -- said of persons
To possess and use, as power; to exercise
To sustain; to have on (written or inscribed, or as a mark), as, the tablet bears this inscription
To possess or carry, as a mark of authority or distinction; to wear; as, to bear a sword, badge, or name
To possess mentally; to carry or hold in the mind; to entertain; to harbor
To endure; to tolerate; to undergo; to suffer
To gain or win
To sustain, or be answerable for, as blame, expense, responsibility, etc
To render or give; to bring forward
To carry on, or maintain; to have
To admit or be capable of; that is, to suffer or sustain without violence, injury, or change
To manage, wield, or direct
To afford; to be to; to supply with
To bring forth or produce; to yield; as, to bear apples; to bear children; to bear interest
To produce, as fruit; to be fruitful, in opposition to barrenness
To suffer, as in carrying a burden
To endure with patience; to be patient
To press; -- with on or upon, or against
To take effect; to have influence or force; as, to bring matters to bear
To relate or refer; -- with on or upon; as, how does this bear on the question?
To have a certain meaning, intent, or effect
To be situated, as to the point of compass, with respect to something else; as, the land bears N. by E
A bier
Any species of the genus Ursus, and of the closely allied genera.  Bears are plantigrade Carnivora, but they live largely on fruit and insects
An animal which has some resemblance to a bear in form or habits, but no real affinity; as, the woolly bear; ant bear; water bear; sea bear
One of two constellations in the northern hemisphere, called respectively the Great Bear and the Lesser Bear, or Ursa Major and Ursa Minor
Metaphorically: A brutal, coarse, or morose person
A person who sells stocks or securities for future delivery in expectation of a fall in the market
A portable punching machine
A block covered with coarse matting; -- used to scour the deck
To endeavor to depress the price of, or prices in; as, to bear a railroad stock; to bear the market
Barley; the six-rowed barley or the four-rowed barley, commonly the former (Hordeum hexastichon or Hordeum vulgare)

bear jam.definition: A traffic jam caused by tourists stopping to look at bears near the road; -- a phenomenon once common in Yellowstone Park, Wyoming

bear state.definition: Arkansas; -- a nickname, from the many bears once inhabiting its forests

bear's-breech.definition: a widely cultivated southern European acanthus (Acanthus mollis) with whitish purple-veined flowers.  See Acanthus, n., 1

bear's-ear.definition: A kind of primrose (Primula auricula), so called from the shape of the leaf

bear's-foot.definition: A species of hellebore (Helleborus fœtidus), with digitate leaves. It has an offensive smell and acrid taste, and is a powerful emetic, cathartic, and anthelmintic

bear's-paw.definition: A large bivalve shell of the East Indies (Hippopus maculatus), often used as an ornament

bear-trap dam.definition: A kind of movable dam, in one form consisting of two leaves resting against each other at the top when raised and folding down one over the other when lowered, for deepening shallow parts in a river

bearable.definition: Capable of being borne or endured; tolerable

bearberry.definition: A trailing plant of the heath family (Arctostaphylos uva-ursi), having leaves which are tonic and astringent, and glossy red berries of which bears are said to be fond

bearcat.definition: an arboreal civet of Asia (Arctictis bintourong) having a long prehensile tail and shaggy black hair

beard.definition: The hair that grows on the chin, lips, and adjacent parts of the human face, chiefly of male adults
The long hairs about the face in animals, as in the goat
Long or stiff hairs on a plant; the awn; as, the beard of grain
A barb or sharp point of an arrow or other instrument, projecting backward to prevent the head from being easily drawn out
That part of the under side of a horse's lower jaw which is above the chin, and bears the curb of a bridle
That part of a type which is between the shoulder of the shank and the face
To take by the beard; to seize, pluck, or pull the beard of (a man), in anger or contempt
To oppose to the face; to set at defiance
To deprive of the gills; -- used only of oysters and similar shellfish

beardie.definition: The bearded loach (Nemachilus barbatus) of Europe

beardless.definition: Without a beard. Hence: Not having arrived at puberty or manhood; youthful
Destitute of an awn; as, beardless wheat

beardlessness.definition: The state or quality of being destitute of beard

beardown.definition: devoting full strength and concentrated attention to

bearer.definition: One who, or that which, bears, sustains, or carries
Specifically: One who assists in carrying a body to the grave; a pallbearer
A palanquin carrier; also, a house servant
A tree or plant yielding fruit; as, a good bearer
One who holds a check, note, draft, or other order for the payment of money; as, pay to bearer
A strip of reglet or other furniture to bear off the impression from a blank page; also, a type or type-high piece of metal interspersed in blank parts to support the plate when it is shaved

bearherd.definition: A man who tends a bear

bearhound.definition: A hound for baiting or hunting bears

bearing.definition: The manner in which one bears or conducts one's self; mien; behavior; carriage
The situation of one object, with respect to another, such situation being supposed to have a connection with the object, or influence upon it, or to be influenced by it; hence, relation; connection
The act, power, or time of producing or giving birth; as, a tree in full bearing; a tree past bearing
That part of any member of a building which rests upon its supports; as, a lintel or beam may have four inches of bearing upon the wall
The part of an axle or shaft in contact with its support, collar, or boxing; the journal
Any single emblem or charge in an escutcheon or coat of arms -- commonly in the pl

The situation of a distant object, with regard to a ship's position, as on the bow, on the lee quarter, etc.; the direction or point of the compass in which an object is seen; as, the bearing of the cape was W. N. W

bearing cloth.definition: A cloth with which a child is covered when carried to be baptized

bearing rein.definition: A short rein looped over the check hook or the hames to keep the horse's head up; -- called in the United States a checkrein

bearing ring.definition: In a balloon, the braced wooden ring attached to the suspension ropes at the bottom, functionally analogous to the keel of a ship

bearish.definition: Partaking of the qualities of a bear; resembling a bear in temper or manners
Fearful of or anticipating falling prices, as in the stock market; as, bearish sentiment inhibited buying
Tending to cause prices to fall

bearishness.definition: Behavior like that of a bear

bearskin.definition: A coarse, shaggy, woolen cloth for overcoats
A cap made of bearskin, esp. one worn by soldiers

bearward.definition: A keeper of bears. See Bearherd

beast.definition: Any living creature; an animal; -- including man, insects, etc
Any four-footed animal, that may be used for labor, food, or sport; as, a beast of burden
any animal other than a human; -- opposed to man
Fig.: A coarse, brutal, filthy, or degraded fellow
A game at cards similar to loo
A penalty at beast, omber, etc. Hence: To be beasted, to be beaten at beast, omber, etc

beasthood.definition: State or nature of a beast

beastliness.definition: The state or quality of being beastly

beastly.definition: Pertaining to, or having the form, nature, or habits of, a beast
Characterizing the nature of a beast; contrary to the nature and dignity of man; brutal; filthy

beat.definition: To strike repeatedly; to lay repeated blows upon; as, to beat one's breast; to beat iron so as to shape it; to beat grain, in order to force out the seeds; to beat eggs and sugar; to beat a drum
To punish by blows; to thrash
To scour or range over in hunting, accompanied with the noise made by striking bushes, etc., for the purpose of rousing game
To dash against, or strike, as with water or wind
To tread, as a path
To overcome in a battle, contest, strife, race, game, etc.; to vanquish, defeat, or conquer; to surpass or be superior to
To cheat; to chouse; to swindle; to defraud; -- often with out
To exercise severely; to perplex; to trouble
To give the signal for, by beat of drum; to sound by beat of drum; as, to beat an alarm, a charge, a parley, a retreat; to beat the general, the reveille, the tattoo. See Alarm, Charge, Parley, etc
to baffle or stump; to defy the comprehension of (a person); as, it beats me why he would do that
to evade, avoid, or escape (blame, taxes, punishment); as, to beat the rap (be acquitted); to beat the sales tax by buying out of state
To strike repeatedly; to inflict repeated blows; to knock vigorously or loudly
To move with pulsation or throbbing
To come or act with violence; to dash or fall with force; to strike anything, as rain, wind, and waves do
To be in agitation or doubt
To make progress against the wind, by sailing in a zigzag line or traverse
To make a sound when struck; as, the drums beat
To make a succession of strokes on a drum; as, the drummers beat to call soldiers to their quarters
To sound with more or less rapid alternations of greater and less intensity, so as to produce a pulsating effect; -- said of instruments, tones, or vibrations, not perfectly in unison
A stroke; a blow
A recurring stroke; a throb; a pulsation; as, a beat of the heart; the beat of the pulse
The rise or fall of the hand or foot, marking the divisions of time; a division of the measure so marked. In the rhythm of music the beat is the unit

A sudden swelling or reënforcement of a sound, recurring at regular intervals, and produced by the interference of sound waves of slightly different periods of vibrations; applied also, by analogy, to other kinds of wave motions; the pulsation or throbbing produced by the vibrating together of two tones not quite in unison. See Beat, v. i., 8
A round or course which is frequently gone over; as, a watchman's beat; analogously, for newspaper reporters, the subject or territory that they are assigned to cover; as, the Washington beat
A place of habitual or frequent resort
A cheat or swindler of the lowest grade; -- often emphasized by dead; as, a dead beat; also, deadbeat
Weary; tired; fatigued; exhausted
One that beats, or surpasses, another or others; as, the beat of him
The act of one that beats a person or thing
The act of scouring, or ranging over, a tract of land to rouse or drive out game; also, those so engaged, collectively
A smart tap on the adversary's blade

beaten.definition: Made smooth by beating or treading; worn by use
Become common or trite; as, a beaten phrase

beaten-up.definition: worn by use into a deplorable condition

beater.definition: One who, or that which, beats
A person who beats up game for the hunters

beath.definition: To bathe; also, to dry or heat, as unseasoned wood

beatific.definition: Having the power to impart or complete blissful enjoyment; blissful

beatification.definition: The act of beatifying, or the state of being beatified; esp., in the R. C. Church, the act or process of ascertaining and declaring that a deceased person is one of “the blessed,” or has attained the second degree of sanctity, -- usually a stage in the process of canonization

beatified.definition: proclaimed one of the blessed and thus worthy of veneration

beatify.definition: To pronounce or regard as happy, or supremely blessed, or as conferring happiness
To make happy; to bless with the completion of celestial enjoyment
To ascertain and declare, by a public process and decree, that a deceased person is one of “the blessed,” and is to be reverenced as such, though not canonized

beating.definition: The act of striking or giving blows; punishment or chastisement by blows
Pulsation; throbbing; as, the beating of the heart
The process of sailing against the wind by tacks in zigzag direction

beatitude.definition: Felicity of the highest kind; consummate bliss
Any one of the nine declarations (called the Beatitudes), made in the Sermon on the Mount (Matt. v. 3-12), with regard to the blessedness of those who are distinguished by certain specified virtues

beatnik.definition: a member of the Beat Generation; a nonconformist in dress and behavior

beau.definition: A man who takes great care to dress in the latest fashion; a dandy
A man who escorts, or pays attentions to, a lady; an escort; a suitor or lover

beau ideal.definition: A conception or image of consummate beauty, moral or physical, formed in the mind, free from all the deformities, defects, and blemishes seen in actual existence; an ideal or faultless standard or model

beau monde.definition: The fashionable world; people of fashion and gayety

beaucatcher.definition: A small flat curl worn on the temple by women

beaufet.definition: A niche, cupboard, or sideboard for plate, china, glass, etc.; a buffet

beaufort's scale.definition: A scale of wind force devised by Sir F. Beaufort, R. N., in 1805, in which the force is indicated by numbers from 0 to 12

beauish.definition: Like a beau; characteristic of a beau; foppish; fine

beaumontague.definition: A cement used in making joints, filling cracks, etc.  For iron, the principal constituents are iron borings and sal ammoniac; for wood, white lead or litharge, whiting, and linseed oil

beauseant.definition: The black and white standard of the Knights Templars

beauship.definition: The state of being a beau; the personality of a beau

beaut.definition: an outstanding example of its kind; as, when I make a mistake it's a beaut

beauteous.definition: Full of beauty; beautiful; very handsome

beautification.definition: the act of making something more beautiful

beautifier.definition: One who, or that which, beautifies or makes beautiful

beautiful.definition: Having the qualities which constitute beauty; pleasing to the sight or the mind

beautify.definition: To make or render beautiful; to add beauty to; to adorn; to deck; to grace; to embellish
To become beautiful; to advance in beauty

beauty.definition: An assemblage of graces or properties pleasing to the eye, the ear, the intellect, the æsthetic faculty, or the moral sense
A particular grace, feature, ornament, or excellence; anything beautiful; as, the beauties of nature
A beautiful person, esp. a beautiful woman
Prevailing style or taste; rage; fashion

beaver.definition: An amphibious rodent, of the genus Castor
A hat, formerly made of the fur of the beaver, but now usually of silk
Beaver cloth, a heavy felted woolen cloth, used chiefly for making overcoats
The hair on a woman's pubic area; -- vulgar
A person who works enthusiastically and diligently; -- used especially in the phrase eager beaver

That piece of armor which protected the lower part of the face, whether forming a part of the helmet or fixed to the breastplate. It was so constructed (with joints or otherwise) that the wearer could raise or lower it to eat and drink

beavered.definition: Covered with, or wearing, a beaver or hat

beaverteen.definition: A kind of fustian made of coarse twilled cotton, shorn after dyeing

bebeerine.definition: An alkaloid got from the bark of the bebeeru, or green heart of Guiana (Nectandra Rodiœi). It is a tonic, antiperiodic, and febrifuge, and is used in medicine as a substitute for quinine

bebeeru.definition: A tropical South American tree (Nectandra Rodiœi), the bark of which yields the alkaloid bebeerine, and the wood of which is known as green heart

bebleed.definition: To make bloody; to stain with blood

beblood.definition: To make bloody; to stain with blood

beblubber.definition: To make swollen and disfigured or sullied by weeping; as, her eyes or cheeks were beblubbered

bebung.definition: A tremolo effect, such as that produced on the piano by vibratory repetition of a note with sustained use of the pedal

becalm.definition: To render calm or quiet; to calm; to still; to appease
To keep from motion, or stop the progress of, by the stilling of the wind; as, the fleet was becalmed

becard.definition: A South American bird of the flycatcher family. (Tityra inquisetor)

because.definition: By or for the cause that; on this account that; for the reason that

beccafico.definition: A small bird. (Silvia hortensis), which is highly prized by the Italians for the delicacy of its flesh in the autumn, when it has fed on figs, grapes, etc

becchi's test.definition: A qualitative test for cottonseed oil, based on the fact this oil imparts a maroon color to an alcoholic solution of silver nitrate

bechamel.definition: A rich, white sauce, prepared with butter and cream

bechance.definition: To befall; to chance; to happen to

bechic.definition: Pertaining to, or relieving, a cough

bechuanas.definition: A division of the Bantus, dwelling between the Orange and Zambezi rivers, supposed to be the most ancient Bantu population of South Africa. They are divided into totemic clans; they are intelligent and progressive

beck.definition: To nod, or make a sign with the head or hand
To notify or call by a nod, or a motion of the head or hand; to intimate a command to
A significant nod, or motion of the head or hand, esp. as a call or command

beck's scale.definition: A hydrometer scale on which the zero point corresponds to sp. gr. 1.00, and the 30°-point to sp. gr. 0.85. From these points the scale is extended both ways, all the degrees being of equal length

becker.definition: A European fish (Pagellus centrodontus); the sea bream or braise

becket.definition: A small grommet, or a ring or loop of rope or metal for holding things in position, as spars, ropes, etc.; also a bracket, a pocket, or a handle made of rope

beckon.definition: To make a significant sign to; hence, to summon, as by a motion of the hand
A sign made without words; a beck

beclap.definition: To catch; to grasp; to insnare

becloud.definition: To cause obscurity or dimness to; to dim; to cloud

become.definition: To pass from one state to another; to enter into some state or condition, by a change from another state, or by assuming or receiving new properties or qualities, additional matter, or a new character
To suit or be suitable to; to be congruous with; to befit; to accord with, in character or circumstances; to be worthy of, or proper for; to cause to appear well; -- said of persons and things

becoming.definition: Appropriate or fit; congruous; suitable; graceful; befitting
That which is becoming or appropriate

becomingness.definition: The quality of being becoming, appropriate, or fit; congruity; fitness

becquerel rays.definition: Radiations first observed by the French physicist Henri Becquerel, in working with uranium and its compounds. They consist of a mixture of alpha, beta, and gamma rays

becripple.definition: To make a cripple of; to cripple; to lame

becuiba.definition: The nut of the Brazilian tree Myristica Bicuhyba, which yields a medicinal balsam used for rheumatism

becuna.definition: A fish of the Mediterranean (Sphyræna spet). See Barracuda

becurl.definition: To curl; to adorn with curls

bed.definition: An article of furniture to sleep or take rest in or on; a couch. Specifically: A sack or mattress, filled with some soft material, in distinction from the bedstead on which it is placed (as, a feather bed), or this with the bedclothes added. In a general sense, any thing or place used for sleeping or reclining on or in, as a quantity of hay, straw, leaves, or twigs
(Used as the symbol of matrimony) Marriage
A plat or level piece of ground in a garden, usually a little raised above the adjoining ground
A mass or heap of anything arranged like a bed; as, a bed of ashes or coals
The bottom of a watercourse, or of any body of water; as, the bed of a river
A layer or seam, or a horizontal stratum between layers; as, a bed of coal, iron, etc
The horizontal surface of a building stone; as, the upper and lower beds
The foundation or the more solid and fixed part or framing of a machine; or a part on which something is laid or supported; as, the bed of an engine
The superficial earthwork, or ballast, of a railroad
The flat part of the press, on which the form is laid
To make partaker of one's bed; to cohabit with
To furnish with a bed or bedding
To plant or arrange in beds; to set, or cover, as in a bed of soft earth; as, to bed the roots of a plant in mold
To lay or put in any hollow place, or place of rest and security, surrounded or inclosed; to embed; to furnish with or place upon a bed or foundation; as, to bed a stone; it was bedded on a rock
To dress or prepare the surface of stone) so as to serve as a bed
To lay flat; to lay in order; to place in a horizontal or recumbent position
To go to bed; to cohabit

bed rock.definition: The solid rock underlying superficial formations.  Also Fig

bed screw.definition: A form of jack screw for lifting large bodies, and assisting in launching
A long screw formerly used to fasten a bedpost to one of the adjacent side pieces

bed steps.definition: Steps for mounting a bed of unusual height

bed-molding.definition: The molding of a cornice immediately below the corona

bedabble.definition: To dabble; to sprinkle or wet

bedaff.definition: To make a daff or fool of

bedagat.definition: The sacred books of the Buddhists in Burmah

bedash.definition: To wet by dashing or throwing water or other liquid upon; to bespatter

bedaub.definition: To daub over; to besmear or soil with anything thick and dirty

bedaubed.definition: ornamented in a vulgar or showy fashion

bedaze.definition: to cause to be senseless, groggy, or dizzy; cause to lose ability to respond normally; desensitize

bedazzle.definition: To dazzle or make dim by a strong light

bedbug.definition: A wingless, bloodsucking, hemipterous insect (Cimex Lectularius), sometimes infesting houses and especially beds.  See Illustration in Appendix

bedchair.definition: A chair with adjustable back, for the sick, to support them while sitting up in bed

bedchamber.definition: A chamber for a bed; an apartment form sleeping in

bedclothes.definition: Blankets, sheets, coverlets, etc., for a bed

bedcord.definition: A cord or rope interwoven in a bedstead so as to support the bed

bedded.definition: Provided with a bed; as, double-bedded room; placed or arranged in a bed or beds

bedder.definition: an ornamental plant suitable for planting in a flowerbed

bedding.definition: A bed and its furniture; the materials of a bed, whether for man or beast; bedclothes; litter
The state or position of beds and layers

bede.definition: To pray; also, to offer; to proffer

bedeck.definition: To deck, ornament, or adorn; to grace

bedeguar.definition: A gall produced on rosebushes, esp. on the sweetbrier or eglantine, by a puncture from the ovipositor of a gallfly (Rhodites rosæ). It was once supposed to have medicinal properties

beden.definition: The Abyssinian or Arabian ibex (Capra Nubiana). It is probably the wild goat of the Bible

bedevil.definition: To throw into utter disorder and confusion, as if by the agency of evil spirits; to bring under diabolical influence; to torment

bedevilment.definition: The state of being bedeviled; bewildering confusion; vexatious trouble

bedew.definition: To moisten with dew, or as with dew

bedewer.definition: One who, or that which, bedews

bedfellow.definition: One who lies with another in the same bed; a person who shares one's couch

bedground.definition: an area on which a drove of cattle or sheep can sleep for a night

bedight.definition: To bedeck; to array or equip; to adorn

bedim.definition: To make dim; to obscure or darken

bedizen.definition: To dress or adorn tawdrily or with false taste

bedizenment.definition: That which bedizens; the act of dressing, or the state of being dressed, tawdrily

bedkey.definition: An instrument for tightening the parts of a bedstead

bedlam.definition: A place appropriated to the confinement and care of the insane; a madhouse
An insane person; a lunatic; a madman
Any place where uproar and confusion prevail
Belonging to, or fit for, a madhouse

bedlamite.definition: An inhabitant of a madhouse; a madman

bedote.definition: To cause to dote; to deceive

bedouin.definition: One of the nomadic Arabs who live in tents, and are scattered over Arabia, Syria, and northern Africa, esp. in the deserts

bedpan.definition: A shallow chamber vessel, so constructed that it can be used by a sick person in bed

bedpiece.definition: The foundation framing or piece, by which the other parts are supported and held in place; the bed; -- called also baseplate and soleplate

bedpost.definition: One of the four standards that support a bedstead or the canopy over a bedstead
Anciently, a post or pin on each side of the bed to keep the clothes from falling off.  See Bedstaff

bedquilt.definition: A quilt for a bed; a coverlet

bedrabble.definition: To befoul with rain and mud; to drabble

bedraggle.definition: To draggle; to soil, as garments which, in walking, are suffered to drag in dust, mud, etc

bedrench.definition: To drench; to saturate with moisture; to soak

bedrid.definition: Confined to the bed by sickness or infirmity

bedright.definition: The duty or privilege of the marriage bed

bedroom.definition: A room or apartment intended or used for a bed; a lodging room

bedsit.definition: a furnished sitting room with sleeping accommodations (and some plumbing)

bedsite.definition: A recess in a room for a bed

bedsitter.definition: a furnished sitting room with sleeping accommodations (and some plumbing)

bedsore.definition: A sore on the back or hips caused by lying for a long time in bed

bedspread.definition: A bedquilt; a counterpane; a coverlet

bedstaff.definition: “A wooden pin stuck anciently on the sides of the bedstead, to hold the clothes from slipping on either side.”

bedstead.definition: A framework for supporting a bed

bedstock.definition: The front or the back part of the frame of a bedstead

bedstraw.definition: A genus of slender herbs, usually with square stems, whorled leaves, and small white flowers

bedswerver.definition: One who swerves from and is unfaithful to the marriage vow

bedtick.definition: A tick or bag made of cloth, used for inclosing the materials of a bed

bedtime.definition: The time to go to bed

beduck.definition: To duck; to put the head under water; to immerse

bedung.definition: To cover with dung, as for manuring; to bedaub or defile, literally or figuratively

bedust.definition: To sprinkle, soil, or cover with dust

bedwarf.definition: To make a dwarf of; to stunt or hinder the growth of; to dwarf

bee.definition: p. p. of Be; -- used for been
An insect of the order Hymenoptera, and family Apidæ (the honeybees), or family Andrenidæ (the solitary bees.) See Honeybee
A neighborly gathering of people who engage in united labor for the benefit of an individual or family; as, a quilting bee; a husking bee; a raising bee
Pieces of hard wood bolted to the sides of the bowsprit, to reeve the fore-topmast stays through; -- called also bee blocks

bee fly.definition: any dipterous insect of the family Bombyliidae, which eat nectar and in some cases resemble bees.  Their larvae are parasitic on the larvae of bees and other insects

bee line.definition: The shortest line from one place to another, like that of a bee to its hive when loaded with honey; an air line

bee-eater.definition: A bird of the genus Merops, that feeds especially on bees. The European species (Merops apiaster) is remarkable for its brilliant colors

beebalm.definition: a perennial herb (Monarda fistulosa) of North America
a perennial aromatic herb of eastern North America (Monarda didyma)  having variously colored tubular flowers in dense showy heads
a bushy perennial Old World mint, Melissa officinalis, having small white or yellowish flowers and fragrant lemon-flavored leaves; a garden escapee in northern Europe and North America

beebread.definition: A brown, bitter substance found in some of the cells of honeycomb. It is made chiefly from the pollen of flowers, which is collected by bees as food for their young

beech.definition: A tree of the genus Fagus

beechen.definition: Consisting, or made, of the wood or bark of the beech; belonging to the beech

beechnut.definition: The nut of the beech tree

beef.definition: An animal of the genus Bos, especially the common species, Bos taurus, including the bull, cow, and ox, in their full grown state; esp., an ox or cow fattened for food
The flesh of an ox, or cow, or of any adult bovine animal, when slaughtered for food
Of, pertaining to, or resembling, beef

beefalo.definition: a hardy breed of beef cattle derived as a cross between the American bison and domestic cattle, usually being genetically 3/8 bison and 5/8 domestic bovine; -- it yields leaner beef than conventional breeds

beefburger.definition: a fried cake of minced beef served on a bun

beefeater.definition: One who eats beef; hence, a large, fleshy person
One of the yeomen of the guard, in England
An African bird of the genus Buphaga, which feeds on the larvæ of botflies hatched under the skin of oxen, antelopes, etc. Two species are known

beefsteak.definition: A steak of beef; a slice of beef broiled or suitable for broiling

beefwood.definition: An Australian tree (Casuarina), and its red wood, used for cabinetwork; also, the trees Stenocarpus salignus of New South Wales, and Banksia compar of Queensland

beefy.definition: Having much beef; of the nature of beef; resembling beef; fleshy

beehive.definition: A hive for a swarm of bees. Also used figuratively

beehouse.definition: A house for bees; an apiary

beelzebub.definition: The title of a heathen deity to whom the Jews ascribed the sovereignty of the evil spirits; hence, the Devil or a devil. See Baal

been.definition: The past participle of Be. In old authors it is also the pr. tense plural of Be. See 1st Bee

beer.definition: A fermented liquor made from any malted grain, but commonly from barley malt, with hops or some other substance to impart a bitter flavor
A fermented extract of the roots and other parts of various plants, as spruce, ginger, sassafras, etc

beer belly.definition: a protruding potbelly caused by excessive drinking of beer

beerhouse.definition: A house where malt liquors are sold; an alehouse

beery.definition: Of or resembling beer; affected by beer; maudlin

beeswax.definition: The wax secreted by bees, and of which their cells are constructed

beeswing.definition: The second crust formed in port and some other wines after long keeping. It consists of pure, shining scales of tartar, supposed to resemble the wing of a bee

beet.definition: A biennial plant of the genus Beta, which produces an edible root the first year and seed the second year
The root of plants of the genus Beta, different species and varieties of which are used for the table, for feeding stock, or in making sugar

beethoven.definition: Ludwig van Beethoven, a renowned German composer, born 1770, died 1827

beethovenian.definition: of or pertaining to Ludwig van Beethoven

beetle.definition: A heavy mallet, used to drive wedges, beat pavements, etc
A machine in which fabrics are subjected to a hammering process while passing over rollers, as in cotton mills; -- called also beetling machine
To beat with a heavy mallet
To finish by subjecting to a hammering process in a beetle or beetling machine; as, to beetle cotton goods
Any insect of the order Coleoptera, having four wings, the outer pair being stiff cases for covering the others when they are folded up. See Coleoptera
To extend over and beyond the base or support; to overhang; to jut

beetle-browed.definition: Having prominent, overhanging brows; hence, lowering or sullen

beetlehead.definition: The black-bellied plover, or bullhead (Squatarola helvetica). See Plover

befall.definition: To come to pass; to happen

befit.definition: To be suitable to; to suit; to become

beflower.definition: To besprinkle or scatter over with, or as with, flowers

befog.definition: To involve in a fog; -- mostly as a participle or part. adj

befogged.definition: confused and vague; used especially of thinking

befool.definition: To fool; to delude or lead into error; to infatuate; to deceive
To cause to behave like a fool; to make foolish

before.definition: In front of; preceding in space; ahead of; as, to stand before the fire; before the house
Preceding in time; earlier than; previously to; anterior to the time when; -- sometimes with the additional idea of purpose; in order that
An advance of; farther onward, in place or time
Prior or preceding in dignity, order, rank, right, or worth; rather than
In presence or sight of; face to face with; facing
Under the cognizance or jurisdiction of
Open for; free of access to; in the power of
On the fore part; in front, or in the direction of the front; -- opposed to in the rear

beforehand.definition: In a state of anticipation ore preoccupation; in advance; -- often followed by with
By way of preparation, or preliminary; previously; aforetime
In comfortable circumstances as regards property; forehanded

befoul.definition: To entangle or run against so as to impede motion

befriend.definition: To act as a friend to; to favor; to aid, benefit, or countenance

befrill.definition: To furnish or deck with a frill

befringe.definition: To furnish with a fringe; to form a fringe upon; to adorn as with fringe

befuddle.definition: To becloud and confuse, as with liquor

befuddled.definition: unclear in mind or intent; filled with bewilderment
confused and vague; used especially of thinking

beg.definition: A title of honor in Turkey and in some other parts of the East; a bey
To ask earnestly for; to entreat or supplicate for; to beseech
To ask for as a charity, esp. to ask for habitually or from house to house
To make petition to; to entreat; as, to beg a person to grant a favor
To take for granted; to assume without proof
To ask to be appointed guardiln for, or to aso to havo a guardian appointed for
To ask alms or charity, especially to ask habitually by the wayside or from house to house; to live by asking alms

begem.definition: To adorn with gems, or as with gems

beget.definition: To procreate, as a father or sire; to generate; -- commonly said of the father
To produce as an effect; to cause to exist

beggar.definition: One who begs; one who asks or entreats earnestly, or with humility; a petitioner
One who makes it his business to ask alms
One who is dependent upon others for support; -- a contemptuous or sarcastic use
One who assumes in argument what he does not prove
To reduce to beggary; to impoverish; as, he had beggared himself
To cause to seem very poor and inadequate

beggar's lice.definition: The prickly fruit or seed of certain plants (as some species of Echinospermum and Cynoglossum) which cling to the clothing of those who brush by them

beggar's ticks.definition: The bur marigold (Bidens) and its achenes, which are armed with barbed awns, and adhere to clothing and fleeces with unpleasant tenacity; -- also called beggar-ticks

beggar-lice.definition: any of various Eurasian and North American plants having small prickly nutlets that stick to clothing
any of various tropical and subtropical plants having trifoliate leaves and rough sticky pod sections or loments

beggar-ticks.definition: any of several plants of the genus Bidens having yellow flowers and pricky fruits that cling to fur and clothing; -- also called beggar's-ticks

beggarhood.definition: The condition of being a beggar; also, the class of beggars

beggarliness.definition: The quality or state of being beggarly; meanness

beggarly.definition: In the condition of, or like, a beggar; suitable for a beggar; extremely indigent; poverty-stricken; mean; poor; contemptible
In an indigent, mean, or despicable manner; in the manner of a beggar

beggarwoman.definition: a woman who is a beggar

beggary.definition: The act of begging; the state of being a beggar; mendicancy; extreme poverty

beghard.definition: One of an association of religious laymen living in imitation of the Beguines. They arose in the thirteenth century, were afterward subjected to much persecution, and were suppressed by Innocent X. in 1650.  Called also Beguins

begin.definition: To have or commence an independent or first existence; to take rise; to commence
To do the first act or the first part of an action; to enter upon or commence something new, as a new form or state of being, or course of action; to take the first step; to start
To trace or lay the foundation of; to make or place a beginning of

beginner.definition: One who begins or originates anything. Specifically: A young or inexperienced practitioner or student; a tyro

beginning.definition: The act of doing that which begins anything; commencement of an action, state, or space of time; entrance into being or upon a course; the first act, effort, or state of a succession of acts or states
That which begins or originates something; the first cause; origin; source
That which is begun; a rudiment or element

begird.definition: To bind with a band or girdle; to gird
To surround as with a band; to encompass

begirdle.definition: To surround as with a girdle

beglerbeg.definition: The governor of a province of the Ottoman empire, next in dignity to the grand vizier

begnaw.definition: To gnaw; to eat away; to corrode

begod.definition: To exalt to the dignity of a god; to deify

begohm.definition: A unit of resistance equal to one billion ohms, or one thousand megohms

benefit society.definition: A society or association formed for mutual insurance, as among tradesmen or in labor unions, to provide for relief in sickness, old age, and for the expenses of burial. Usually called friendly society in Great Britain

benefiter.definition: One who confers a benefit; -- also, one who receives a benefit

benet.definition: To catch in a net; to insnare

benevolence.definition: The disposition to do good; good will; charitableness; love of mankind, accompanied with a desire to promote their happiness
An act of kindness; good done; charity given
A species of compulsory contribution or tax, which has sometimes been illegally exacted by arbitrary kings of England, and falsely represented as a gratuity

benevolent.definition: Having a disposition to do good; possessing or manifesting love to mankind, and a desire to promote their prosperity and happiness; disposed to give to good objects; kind; charitable

bengal.definition: A province in India, giving its name to various stuffs, animals, etc
A thin stuff, made of silk and hair, originally brought from Bengal
Striped gingham, originally brought from Bengal; Bengal stripes

bengali.definition: Of or pertaining to the Bengali language; as, Bengali poetry
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of Bangladesh (formerly Bengal) or its inhabitants; as, Bengali hills

benghazi.definition: One of the capital cities of Libya

benight.definition: To involve in darkness; to shroud with the shades of night; to obscure
To overtake with night or darkness, especially before the end of a day's journey or task
To involve in moral darkness, or ignorance; to debar from intellectual light

benign.definition: Of a kind or gentle disposition; gracious; generous; favorable; benignant
Exhibiting or manifesting kindness, gentleness, favor, etc.; mild; kindly; salutary; wholesome
Of a mild type or character; as, a benign disease

benignity.definition: The quality of being benign; goodness; kindness; graciousness

beninese.definition: of, pertaining to, or characteristic of Benin
a native or inhabitant of Benin

benjamin.definition: A kind of upper coat for men

benjamite.definition: A descendant of Benjamin; one of the tribe of Benjamin

benne.definition: The name of two plants (Sesamum orientale and Sesamum indicum), originally Asiatic; -- also called oil plant. From their seeds an oil is expressed, called benne oil or sesame oil, used mostly for making soap. In the southern United States the seeds are used in candy

bennet.definition: The common yellow-flowered avens of Europe (Geum urbanum); herb bennet. The name is sometimes given to other plants, as the hemlock, valerian, etc

bennettitales.definition: an order of fossil gymnospermous plans of the Carboniferous

bennettitis.definition: the type genus of the Bennettitales

benni.definition: an East Indian annual erect herb (Sesamum indicum); the source of sesame seed or benniseed and sesame oil.  Same as benne

bennie.definition: a slang name for Benzedrine, a trademark for one brand of amphetamine; -- also used generically for any brand of amphetamine

benniseed.definition: the small oval seed of the sesame plant

bent.definition: Changed by pressure so as to be no longer straight; crooked; as, a bent pin; a bent lever

Strongly inclined toward something, so as to be resolved, determined, set, etc.; -- said of the mind, character, disposition, desires, etc., and used with on; as, to be bent on going to college; he is bent on mischief
The state of being curved, crooked, or inclined from a straight line; flexure; curvity; as, the bent of a bow
A declivity or slope, as of a hill
A leaning or bias; proclivity; tendency of mind; inclination; disposition; purpose; aim
Particular direction or tendency; flexion; course
A transverse frame of a framed structure
Tension; force of acting; energy; impetus
A reedlike grass; a stalk of stiff, coarse grass
A grass of the genus Agrostis, esp. Agrostis vulgaris, or redtop. The name is also used of many other grasses, esp. in America
Any neglected field or broken ground; a common; a moor

bentgrass.definition: grass for pastures and lawns esp bowling and putting greens

benthal.definition: Relating to the deepest zone or region of the ocean

benthamic.definition: Of or pertaining to Bentham or Benthamism

benthamism.definition: That phase of the doctrine of utilitarianism taught by Jeremy Bentham; the doctrine that the morality of actions is estimated and determined by their utility; also, the theory that the sensibility to pleasure and the recoil from pain are the only motives which influence human desires and actions, and that these are the sufficient explanation of ethical and jural conceptions

benthic.definition: of, pertaining to, or occurring at the bottom of a body of water, especially referring to the ocean depths

benthos.definition: The bottom of the sea, esp. of the deep oceans

benting time.definition: The season when pigeons are said to feed on bents, before peas are ripe

bentonite.definition: An absorbent aluminum silicate clay formed from volcanic ash

benty.definition: Abounding in bents, or the stalks of coarse, stiff, withered grass; as, benty fields

benumb.definition: To make torpid; to deprive of sensation or sensibility; to stupefy; as, a hand or foot benumbed by cold

benumbed.definition: Made torpid; numbed; stupefied; deadened; as, a benumbed body and mind

benumbment.definition: Act of benumbing, or state of being benumbed; torpor

benzal.definition: A compound radical, C6H5.CH=, of the aromatic series, related to benzyl and benzoyl; -- used adjectively or in combination

benzamide.definition: A transparent crystalline substance, C6H5.CO.NH2, obtained by the action of ammonia upon chloride of benzoyl, as also by several other reactions with benzoyl compounds

benzene.definition: A volatile, very inflammable liquid, C6H6, contained in the naphtha produced by the destructive distillation of coal, from which it is separated by fractional distillation. The name is sometimes applied also to the impure commercial product or benzole, and also, but rarely, to a similar mixed product of petroleum

benzenoid.definition: similar to benzene in structure or linkage; having an aromatic ring system

benzile.definition: A yellowish crystalline substance, C6H5.CO.CO.C6H5, formed from benzoin by the action of oxidizing agents, and consisting of a doubled benzoyl radical

benzine.definition: A liquid consisting mainly of the lighter and more volatile hydrocarbons of petroleum or kerosene oil, used as a solvent and for cleansing soiled fabrics; -- called also petroleum spirit, petroleum benzine. Varieties or similar products are gasoline, naphtha, rhigolene, ligroin, etc

benzoate.definition: A salt formed by the union of benzoic acid with any salifiable base

benzocaine.definition: a chemical substance obtainable as a white crystalline ester (H2N.C6H4.CO.O.C2H5) used as a local anesthetic.  Chemically, it is 4-aminobenzoic acid ethyl ester

benzoic.definition: Pertaining to, or obtained from, benzoin

benzoin.definition: A resinous substance, dry and brittle, obtained from the Styrax benzoin, a tree of Sumatra, Java, etc., having a fragrant odor, and slightly aromatic taste. It is used in the preparation of benzoic acid, in medicine, and as a perfume
A white crystalline substance, C14H12O2, obtained from benzoic aldehyde and some other sources

benzoinated.definition: Containing or impregnated with benzoin; as, benzoinated lard

benzole.definition: An impure benzene, used in the arts as a solvent, and for various other purposes. See Benzene

benzonaphthol.definition: A white crystalline powder used as an intestinal antiseptic; beta-naphthol benzoate

benzosol.definition: Guaiacol benzoate, used as an intestinal antiseptic and as a substitute for creosote in phthisis. It is a colorless crystalline pewder

benzoyl.definition: A compound radical, C6H5.CO-; the base of benzoic acid, of the oil of bitter almonds, and of an extensive series of compounds

benzyl.definition: A compound radical, C6H5.CH2, related to toluene and benzoic acid; -- commonly used adjectively

bepaint.definition: To paint; to cover or color with, or as with, paint

bepinch.definition: To pinch, or mark with pinches

beplaster.definition: To plaster over; to cover or smear thickly; to bedaub

bepommel.definition: To pommel; to beat, as with a stick; figuratively, to assail or criticise in conversation, or in writing

bepowder.definition: To sprinkle or cover with powder; to powder

bepurple.definition: To tinge or dye with a purple color

bequeath.definition: To give or leave by will; to give by testament; -- said especially of personal property
To give; to offer; to commit

bequeathal.definition: The act of bequeathing; bequeathment; bequest

bequeathment.definition: The act of bequeathing, or the state of being bequeathed; a bequest

bequest.definition: The act of bequeathing or leaving by will; as, a bequest of property by A. to B
That which is left by will, esp. personal property; a legacy; also, a gift
To bequeath, or leave as a legacy

bequote.definition: To quote constantly or with great frequency

berain.definition: To rain upon; to wet with rain

berate.definition: To rate or chide vehemently; to scold

berattle.definition: To make rattle; to scold vociferously; to cry down

beray.definition: To make foul; to soil; to defile

berbe.definition: An African genet (Genetta pardina). See Genet

berber.definition: A member of a race somewhat resembling the Arabs, but often classed as Hamitic, who were formerly the inhabitants of the whole of North Africa from the Mediterranean southward into the Sahara, and who still occupy a large part of that region; -- called also Kabyles. Also, the language spoken by this people

berberine.definition: An alkaloid obtained, as a bitter, yellow substance, from the root of the barberry, gold thread, and other plants

berceuse.definition: A vocal or instrumental composition of a soft tranquil character, having a lulling effect; a cradle song

bercy.definition: a sauce prepared from butter creamed with white wine, shallots, parsley and fish stock; -- also called Bercy sauce

bereave.definition: To make destitute; to deprive; to strip; -- with of before the person or thing taken away

bereaved.definition: mourning due to the death of a loved one

bereavement.definition: The state of being bereaved; deprivation; esp., the loss of a relative by death

beret.definition: a cap made of soft cloth with no brim or bill, widening somewhat outward from a close-fitting headband to a flat top, which often has a button or tab in its center

berg.definition: A large mass or hill, as of ice

bergall.definition: a small wrasse (Tautogolabrus adspersus), common in north Atantic coastal waters of the U. S.; -- also called the cunner

bergamot.definition: A tree of the Orange family (Citrus bergamia), having a roundish or pear-shaped fruit, from the rind of which an essential oil of delicious odor is extracted, much prized as a perfume. Also, the fruit
The essence or perfume made from the fruit
A variety of snuff perfumed with bergamot
A coarse tapestry, manufactured from flock of cotton or hemp, mixed with ox's or goat's hair; -- said to have been invented at Bergamo, Italy.  Encyc. Brit

bergander.definition: A European duck (Anas tadorna). See Sheldrake

bergmeal.definition: An earthy substance, resembling fine flour. It is composed of the shells of infusoria, and in Lapland and Sweden is sometimes eaten, mixed with flour or ground birch bark, in times of scarcity. This name is also given to a white powdery variety of calcite

bergomask.definition: A rustic dance, so called in ridicule of the people of Bergamo, in Italy, once noted for their clownishness

bergschrund.definition: The crevasse or series of crevasses, usually deep and often broad, frequently occurring near the head of a mountain glacier, about where the névé field joins the valley portion of the glacier

bergstock.definition: A long pole with a spike at the end, used in climbing mountains; an alpenstock

berhyme.definition: To mention in rhyme or verse; to rhyme about

beriberi.definition: An acute disease occurring in India, characterized by multiple inflammatory changes in the nerves, producing great muscular debility, a painful rigidity of the limbs, and cachexy

bering sea controversy.definition: A controversy (1886 -- 93) between Great Britain and the United States as to the right of Canadians not licensed by the United States to carry on seal fishing in the Bering Sea, over which the United States claimed jurisdiction as a mare clausum. A court of arbitration, meeting in Paris in 1893, decided against the claim of the United States, but established regulations for the preservation of the fur seal

berkeleian.definition: Of or relating to Bishop Berkeley or his system of idealism; as, Berkeleian philosophy

berkelium.definition: a chemical element of the transuranic series.  Chemical symbol Bk; atomic number 97; atomic weight 247.  It is a radioactive element, with no stable isotopes; the longest-lived isotope is of mass number 247.07, decaying by alpha-emission with a half-life of 1,400 years.  The isotope with atomic weight 249 has a half-life of 314 days, and was isolated in weighable quantities

berlin.definition: The capital city of Germany.  Population (2000) =  3,471,418
A four-wheeled carriage, having a sheltered seat behind the body and separate from it, invented in the 17th century, at Berlin
Fine worsted for fancy-work; zephyr worsted; -- called also Berlin wool

berm.definition: A narrow shelf or path between the bottom of a parapet and the ditch
A ledge at the bottom of a bank or cutting, to catch earth that may roll down the slope, or to strengthen the bank

bermuda grass.definition: A kind of grass (Cynodon Dactylon) esteemed for pasture in the Southern United States.  It is a native of Southern Europe, but is now wide-spread in warm countries; -- called also scutch grass, and in Bermuda, devil grass

bermuda lily.definition: The large white lily (Lilium longiflorum eximium, syn. Lilium Harrisii) which is extensively cultivated in Bermuda

bermudan.definition: of, pertaining to, or characteristic of Bermuda; as, Bermudan beaches
of or pertaining to Bermudans; as, The Bermudan hotel staff
a native or inhabitant of Bermuda

bermudas.definition: a group of islands in the Atlantic off the Carolina coast; British colony; resort

bermudian.definition: a native or inhabitant of Bermuda

bern.definition: The capital city of Switzerland.  Population (2000) = 129,423

berna fly.definition: A Brazilian dipterous insect of the genus Trypeta, which lays its eggs in the nostrils or in wounds of man and beast, where the larvæ do great injury

bernardine.definition: Of or pertaining to St. Bernard of Clairvaux, or to the Cistercian monks

bernese.definition: Pertaining to the city or canton of Bern, in Switzerland, or to its inhabitants

beroe.definition: A small, oval, transparent jellyfish, belonging to the Ctenophora

berretta.definition: A square cap worn by ecclesiastics of the Roman Catholic Church. A cardinal's berretta is scarlet; that worn by other clerics is black, except that a bishop's is lined with green

berried.definition: Furnished with berries; consisting of a berry; baccate; as, a berried shrub

berry.definition: Any small fleshy fruit, as the strawberry, mulberry, huckleberry, etc
A small fruit that is pulpy or succulent throughout, having seeds loosely imbedded in the pulp, as the currant, grape, blueberry
One of the ova or eggs of a fish

berrying.definition: A seeking for or gathering of berries, esp. of such as grow wild

berseem.definition: An Egyptian clover (Trifolium alexandrinum) extensively cultivated as a forage plant and soil-renewing crop in the alkaline soils of the Nile valley, and now introduced into the southwestern United States. It is more succulent than other clovers or than alfalfa. Called also Egyptian clover

berserk.definition: One of a class of legendary heroes, who fought frenzied by intoxicating liquors, and naked, regardless of wounds
One who fights as if frenzied, like a Berserker
frenzied; crazed; usually in predicate position

berteroa.definition: a genus of plants comprising the hoary alyssum

berth.definition: An allotted place; an appointment; situation or employment
A place in a ship to sleep in; a long box or shelf on the side of a cabin or stateroom, or of a railway car, for sleeping in
To give an anchorage to, or a place to lie at; to place in a berth; as, she was berthed stem to stern with the Adelaide
To allot or furnish berths to, on shipboard; as, to berth a ship's company

bertha.definition: A kind of collar or cape worn by ladies

berthage.definition: A place for mooring vessels in a dock or harbor

berthierite.definition: A double sulphide of antimony and iron, of a dark steel-gray color

berthing.definition: The planking outside of a vessel, above the sheer strake

bertillon system.definition: A system for the identification of persons by a physical description based upon anthropometric measurements, notes of markings, deformities, color, impression of thumb lines, etc

berycoid.definition: Of or pertaining to the Berycidæ, a family of marine fishes

beryl.definition: A mineral of great hardness, and, when transparent, of much beauty. It occurs in hexagonal prisms, commonly of a green or bluish green color, but also yellow, pink, and white. It is a silicate of aluminum and beryllium. The aquamarine is a transparent, sea-green variety used as a gem. The emerald is another variety highly prized in jewelry, and distinguished by its deep color, which is probably due to the presence of a little oxide of chromium

berylline.definition: Like a beryl; of a light or bluish green color

beryllium.definition: A metallic element found in the beryl. See Glucinum

berylloid.definition: A solid consisting of a double twelve-sided pyramid; -- so called because the planes of this form occur on crystals of beryl

besaiel.definition: A kind of writ which formerly lay where a great-grandfather died seized of lands in fee simple, and on the day of his death a stranger abated or entered and kept the heir out. This is now abolished

bescatter.definition: To cover sparsely by scattering (something); to strew

bescratch.definition: To tear with the nails; to cover with scratches

bescrawl.definition: To cover with scrawls; to scribble over

bescreen.definition: To cover with a screen, or as with a screen; to shelter; to conceal

bescumber.definition: To discharge ordure or dung upon

besee.definition: To see; to look; to mind

beseech.definition: To ask or entreat with urgency; to supplicate; to implore

beseeching.definition: Entreating urgently; imploring; as, a beseeching look

beseechment.definition: The act of beseeching or entreating earnestly

beseem.definition: Literally: To appear or seem (well, ill, best, etc.) for (one) to do or to have. Hence: To be fit, suitable, or proper for, or worthy of; to become; to befit
To seem; to appear; to be fitting

beset.definition: To set or stud (anything) with ornaments or prominent objects
To hem in; to waylay; to surround; to besiege; to blockade
To set upon on all sides; to perplex; to harass; -- said of dangers, obstacles, etc
To occupy; to employ; to use up

besetment.definition: The act of besetting, or the state of being beset; also, that which besets one, as a sin

besetter.definition: One who, or that which, besets

besetting.definition: Habitually attacking, harassing, or pressing upon or about; as, a besetting sin

beshow.definition: A large food fish (Anoplopoma fimbria) of the north Pacific coast; -- called also candlefish

beshroud.definition: To cover with, or as with, a shroud; to screen

besides.definition: More than that; over and above; not included in the number, or in what has been mentioned; moreover; in addition
Over and above; separate or distinct from; in addition to; other than; else than. See Beside, prep., 3, and Syn. under Beside

besiege.definition: To beset or surround with armed forces, for the purpose of compelling to surrender; to lay siege to; to beleaguer; to beset

besiegement.definition: The act of besieging, or the state of being besieged

besieger.definition: One who besieges; -- opposed to the besieged

besit.definition: To suit; to fit; to become

beslaver.definition: To defile with slaver; to beslobber

beslime.definition: To daub with slime; to soil

beslobber.definition: To slobber on; to smear with spittle running from the mouth. Also Fig.: as, to beslobber with praise

besmear.definition: To smear with any viscous, glutinous matter; to bedaub; to soil

besmirch.definition: To smirch or soil; to discolor; to obscure. Hence: To dishonor; to sully

besmoke.definition: To harden or dry in smoke

besmut.definition: To blacken with smut; to foul with soot

besnow.definition: To scatter like snow; to cover thick, as with snow flakes
To cover with snow; to whiten with snow, or as with snow

besom.definition: A brush of twigs for sweeping; a broom; anything which sweeps away or destroys
To sweep, as with a besom

besort.definition: To assort or be congruous with; to fit, or become

besot.definition: To make sottish; to make dull or stupid; to stupefy; to infatuate

besotted.definition: Made sottish, senseless, or infatuated; characterized by drunken stupidity, or by infatuation; stupefied

bespangle.definition: To adorn with spangles; to dot or sprinkle with something brilliant or glittering

bespangled.definition: covered with beads or jewels or sequins

bespatter.definition: To soil by spattering; to sprinkle, esp. with dirty water, mud, or anything which will leave foul spots or stains
To asperse with calumny or reproach

bespawl.definition: To daub, soil, or make foul with spawl or spittle

bespeak.definition: To speak or arrange for beforehand; to order or engage against a future time; as, to bespeak goods, a right, or a favor
To show beforehand; to foretell; to indicate
To betoken; to show; to indicate by external marks or appearances
A bespeaking. Among actors, a benefit (when a particular play is bespoken.)

bespeckle.definition: To mark with speckles or spots

bespew.definition: To soil or daub with spew; to vomit on

bespice.definition: To season with spice, or with some spicy drug

bespit.definition: To daub or soil with spittle

bespoken.definition: bound by an agreement to become married to someone

bespot.definition: To mark with spots, or as with spots

besprinkle.definition: To sprinkle over; to scatter over

besprinkler.definition: One who, or that which, besprinkles

besprinkling.definition: The act of sprinkling anything; a sprinkling over

bespurt.definition: To spurt on or over; to asperse

bessemer steel.definition: Steel made directly from cast iron, by burning out a portion of the carbon and other impurities that the latter contains, through the agency of a blast of air which is forced through the molten metal; -- so called from Sir Henry Bessemer, an English engineer, the inventor of the process

besseya.definition: a genus of North American spring wildflowers

best.definition: Having good qualities in the highest degree; most good, kind, desirable, suitable, etc.; most excellent; as, the best man; the best road; the best cloth; the best abilities
Most advanced; most correct or complete; as, the best scholar; the best view of a subject
Most; largest; as, the best part of a week
Utmost; highest endeavor or state; most nearly perfect thing, or being, or action; as, to do one's best; to the best of our ability
In the highest degree; beyond all others
To the most advantage; with the most success, case, profit, benefit, or propriety
Most intimately; most thoroughly or correctly; as, what is expedient is best known to himself

bestar.definition: To sprinkle with, or as with, stars; to decorate with, or as with, stars; to bestud

bestead.definition: To put in a certain situation or condition; to circumstance; to place
To put in peril; to beset
To serve; to assist; to profit; to avail

bestial.definition: Belonging to a beast, or to the class of beasts
Having the qualities of a beast; brutal; below the dignity of reason or humanity; irrational; carnal; beastly; sensual
A domestic animal; also collectively, cattle; as, other kinds of bestial

bestiality.definition: The state or quality of being bestial

bestialize.definition: To make bestial, or like a beast; to degrade; to brutalize

bestiary.definition: A treatise on beasts; esp., one of the moralizing or allegorical beast tales written in the Middle Ages

bestick.definition: To stick over, as with sharp points pressed in; to mark by infixing points or spots here and there; to pierce

bestir.definition: To put into brisk or vigorous action; to move with life and vigor; -- usually with the reciprocal pronoun

bestow.definition: To lay up in store; to deposit for safe keeping; to stow; to place; to put
To use; to apply; to devote, as time or strength in some occupation
To give or confer; to impart; -- with on or upon
To demean; to conduct; to behave; -- followed by a reflexive pronoun

bestowment.definition: The act of giving or bestowing; a conferring or bestowal
That which is given or bestowed

bestraught.definition: Out of one's senses; distracted; mad

bestrew.definition: To strew or scatter over; to besprinkle

bestride.definition: To stand or sit with anything between the legs, or with the legs astride; to stand over
To step over; to stride over or across; as, to bestride a threshold

bestud.definition: To set or adorn, as with studs or bosses; to set thickly; to stud; as, to bestud with stars

bet.definition: That which is laid, staked, or pledged, as between two parties, upon the event of a contest or any contingent issue; the act of giving such a pledge; a wager
To stake or pledge upon the event of a contingent issue; to wager

beta.definition: The second letter of the Greek alphabet, B, β. See B, and cf. etymology of Alphabet

beta rays.definition: a form of ionizing radiation emitted by radioactive substances (such as radium), more penetrating than alpha rays, and consisting of negatively charged electrons. The electrons are the same kind of particle as those of cathode rays, but have much higher velocities (about 35,000 to 180,000 miles per second).  They are readily deflected by a magnetic or electric field

betacism.definition: Excessive or extended use of the b sound in speech, due to conversion of other sounds into it, as through inability to distinguish them from  b, or because of difficulty in pronouncing them

betaine.definition: A nitrogenous base, C5H11NO2, produced artificially, and also occurring naturally in beet-root molasses and its residues, from which it is extracted as a white crystalline substance; -- called also lycine and oxyneurine. It has a sweetish taste

betake.definition: To have recourse to; to apply; to resort; to go; -- with a reflexive pronoun
To commend or intrust to; to commit to

betatron.definition: a type of particle accelerator which accelerates a continuous beam of electrons to high speeds by means of the electric field produced by changing magnetic flux

bete.definition: To better; to mend. See Beete

bete noire.definition: Something especially hated or dreaded; a bugbear

beteela.definition: An East India muslin, formerly used for cravats, veils, etc

beteem.definition: To give ; to bestow; to grant; to accord; to consent
To allow; to permit; to suffer

betel.definition: A species of pepper (Piper betle), the leaves of which are chewed, with the areca or betel nut and a little shell lime, by the inhabitants of the East Indies. It is a woody climber with ovate many-nerved leaves

betel nut.definition: The nutlike seed of the areca palm, chewed in the East with betel leaves (whence its name) and shell lime

betelguese.definition: A bright star of the first magnitude, near one shoulder of Orion

beth.definition: the 2nd letter of the Hebrew alphabet

bethabara wood.definition: A highly elastic wood, used for fishing rods, etc. The tree is unknown, but it is thought to be East Indian

bethel.definition: A place of worship; a hallowed spot
A house of worship for seamen

bethink.definition: To call to mind; to recall or bring to recollection, reflection, or consideration; to think; to consider; -- generally followed by a reflexive pronoun, often with of or that before the subject of thought
To think; to recollect; to consider

bethlehem.definition: A hospital for lunatics; -- corrupted into bedlam
In the Ethiopic church, a small building attached to a church edifice, in which the bread for the eucharist is made

bethlehemite.definition: An inhabitant of Bethlehem in Judea
An insane person; a madman; a bedlamite
One of an extinct English order of monks

bethrall.definition: To reduce to thralldom; to inthrall

bethumb.definition: To handle; to wear or soil by handling; as books

betide.definition: To happen to; to befall; to come to ; as, woe betide the wanderer
To come to pass; to happen; to occur

betime.definition: In good season or time; before it is late; seasonably; early
In a short time; soon; speedily; forth with

betitle.definition: To furnish with a title or titles; to entitle

betoken.definition: To signify by some visible object; to show by signs or tokens
To foreshow by present signs; to indicate something future by that which is seen or known; as, a dark cloud often betokens a storm

beton.definition: The French name for concrete; hence, concrete made after the French fashion

betongue.definition: To attack with the tongue; to abuse; to insult

betony.definition: A plant of the genus Betonica (Linn.)

betoss.definition: To put in violent motion; to agitate; to disturb; to toss

betrap.definition: To draw into, or catch in, a trap; to insnare; to circumvent
To put trappings on; to clothe; to deck

betray.definition: To deliver into the hands of an enemy by treachery or fraud, in violation of trust; to give up treacherously or faithlessly; as, an officer betrayed the city
To prove faithless or treacherous to, as to a trust or one who trusts; to be false to; to deceive; as, to betray a person or a cause
To violate the confidence of, by disclosing a secret, or that which one is bound in honor not to make known
To disclose or discover, as something which prudence would conceal; to reveal unintentionally
To mislead; to expose to inconvenience not foreseen to lead into error or sin
To lead astray, as a maiden; to seduce (as under promise of marriage) and then abandon
To show or to indicate; -- said of what is not obvious at first, or would otherwise be concealed

betrayal.definition: The act or the result of betraying

betrayer.definition: One who, or that which, betrays

betrim.definition: To set in order; to adorn; to deck, to embellish; to trim

betroth.definition: To contract to any one for a marriage; to engage or promise in order to marriage; to affiance; -- used esp. of a woman
To promise to take (as a future spouse); to plight one's troth to
To nominate to a bishopric, in order to consecration

betrothal.definition: The act of betrothing, or the fact of being betrothed; a mutual promise, engagement, or contract for a future marriage between the persons betrothed; betrothment; affiance

betrothment.definition: The act of betrothing, or the state of being betrothed; betrothal

betrustment.definition: The act of intrusting, or the thing intrusted

better.definition: Having good qualities in a greater degree than another; as, a better man; a better physician; a better house; a better air
Preferable in regard to rank, value, use, fitness, acceptableness, safety, or in any other respect
Improved in health; less affected with disease; as, the patient is better
More advanced; more perfect; as, upon better acquaintance; a better knowledge of the subject
Advantage, superiority, or victory; -- usually with of; as, to get the better of an enemy
One who has a claim to precedence; a superior, as in merit, social standing, etc.; -- usually in the plural
In a superior or more excellent manner; with more skill and wisdom, courage, virtue, advantage, or success; as, Henry writes better than John; veterans fight better than recruits
In a higher or greater degree; more; as, to love one better than another
More, in reference to value, distance, time, etc.; as, ten miles and better
To improve or ameliorate; to increase the good qualities of
To improve the condition of, morally, physically, financially, socially, or otherwise
To surpass in excellence; to exceed; to excel
To give advantage to; to support; to advance the interest of
One who bets or lays a wager

better-known.definition: more familiar or renowned than the other of two.  Antonym of lesser-known

better-looking.definition: more pleasing in appearance especially by reason of conformity to ideals of form and proportion

better-off.definition: being in a more prosperous condition

bettering.definition: changing for the better; -- antonym of worsening

betterment.definition: An improvement of an estate which renders it better than mere repairing would do; -- generally used in the plural

betterness.definition: The quality of being better or superior; superiority
The difference by which fine gold or silver exceeds in fineness the standard

bettong.definition: A small, leaping Australian marsupial of the genus Bettongia; the jerboa kangaroo

bettongia.definition: a genus of marsupials including the jerboa kangaroo, the bettong

betty.definition: A short bar used by thieves to wrench doors open
A name of contempt given to a man who interferes with the duties of women in a household, or who occupies himself with womanish matters
A pear-shaped bottle covered round with straw, in which olive oil is sometimes brought from Italy; -- called by chemists a Florence flask

betulaceae.definition: a natural family of monoecious trees and shrubs, including the  genera Betula; Alnus; Carpinus; Corylus; Ostrya; and Ostryopsis

betulin.definition: a term originally applied to a substance obtained as a resin or tar by extraction from the outer bark of the common European white birch (Betula alba); now referring to the chemical compound (C30H50O2) having a cyclopentanophenanthrene ring system, which is the main constituent of that extract, and which may be obtained crystalline; -- called also birch camphor

betumble.definition: To throw into disorder; to tumble

between.definition: In the space which separates; betwixt; as, New York is between Boston and Philadelphia
Used in expressing motion from one body or place to another; from one to another of two
Belonging in common to two; shared by both
Belonging to, or participated in by, two, and involving reciprocal action or affecting their mutual relation; as, opposition between science and religion

With relation to two, as involved in an act or attribute of which another is the agent or subject; as, to judge between or to choose between courses; to distinguish between you and me; to mediate between nations
In intermediate relation to, in respect to time, quantity, or degree; as, between nine and ten o'clock

betwixt.definition: In the space which separates; between
From one to another of; mutually affecting

beurre.definition: A beurré (or buttery) pear, one with the meat soft and melting; -- used with a distinguishing word; as, Beurré d'Anjou; Beurré Clairgeau

bevatron.definition: a particle accelerator which is capable of accelerating protons up to 6 gigaeletron volts

bevel.definition: Any angle other than a right angle; the angle which one surface makes with another when they are not at right angles; the slant or inclination of such surface; as, to give a bevel to the edge of a table or a stone slab; the bevel of a piece of timber

An instrument consisting of two rules or arms, jointed together at one end, and opening to any angle, for adjusting the surfaces of work to the same or a given inclination; -- called also a bevel square
Having the slant of a bevel; slanting
To cut to a bevel angle; to slope the edge or surface of
To deviate or incline from an angle of 90°, as a surface; to slant

bevel gear.definition: A kind of gear in which the two wheels working together lie in different planes, and have their teeth cut at right angles to the surfaces of two cones whose apices coincide with the point where the axes of the wheels would meet

beveled.definition: Formed to a bevel angle; sloping; as, the beveled edge of a table
Replaced by two planes inclining equally upon the adjacent planes, as an edge; having its edges replaced by sloping planes, as a cube or other solid

bevelment.definition: The replacement of an edge by two similar planes, equally inclined to the including faces or adjacent planes

bever.definition: A light repast between meals; a lunch
To take a light repast between meals

beverage.definition: Liquid for drinking; drink; -- usually applied to drink artificially prepared and of an agreeable flavor; as, an intoxicating beverage
Specifically, a name applied to various kinds of drink

bevile.definition: A chief broken or opening like a carpenter's bevel

beviled.definition: Notched with an angle like that inclosed by a carpenter's bevel; -- said of a partition line of a shield

bevy.definition: A company; an assembly or collection of persons, especially of ladies
A flock of birds, especially quails or larks; also, a herd of roes

bewail.definition: To express deep sorrow for, as by wailing; to lament; to wail over

bewailable.definition: Such as may, or ought to, be bewailed; lamentable

bewake.definition: To keep watch over; to keep awake

beware.definition: To be on one's guard; to be cautious; to take care; -- commonly followed by of or lest before the thing that is to be avoided
To have a special regard; to heed
To avoid; to take care of; to have a care for

bewash.definition: To drench or souse with water

beweep.definition: To weep over; to deplore; to bedew with tears

bewhore.definition: To corrupt with regard to chastity; to make a whore of
To pronounce or characterize as a whore

bewig.definition: To cover (the head) with a wig

bewildered.definition: Greatly perplexed; as, a bewildered mind

bewilderedness.definition: The state of being bewildered; bewilderment

bewildering.definition: Causing bewilderment or great perplexity; as, bewildering difficulties

bewit.definition: A double slip of leather by which bells are fastened to a hawk's legs

bewitch.definition: To gain an ascendency over by charms or incantations; to affect (esp. to injure) by witchcraft or sorcery
To charm; to fascinate; to please to such a degree as to take away the power of resistance; to enchant

bewitchery.definition: The power of bewitching or fascinating; bewitchment; charm; fascination

bewitching.definition: Having power to bewitch or fascinate; enchanting; captivating; charming

bewitchment.definition: The act of bewitching, or the state of being bewitched
The power of bewitching or charming

bewray.definition: To expose; to reveal; to disclose; to betray

bewrayer.definition: One who, or that which, bewrays; a revealer

bey.definition: A governor of a province or district in the Turkish dominions; also, in some places, a prince or nobleman; a beg; as, the bey of Tunis

beylic.definition: The territory ruled by a bey

beyond.definition: On the further side of; in the same direction as, and further on or away than
At a place or time not yet reached; before
Past, out of the reach or sphere of; further than; greater than; as, the patient was beyond medical aid; beyond one's strength
In a degree or amount exceeding or surpassing; proceeding to a greater degree than; above, as in dignity, excellence, or quality of any kind
Further away; at a distance; yonder

bez-antler.definition: The second branch of a stag's horn

bezant.definition: A gold coin of Byzantium or Constantinople, varying in weight and value, usually (those current in England) between a sovereign and a half sovereign. There were also white or silver bezants
A circle in or, i. e., gold, representing the gold coin called bezant
A decoration of a flat surface, as of a band or belt, representing circular disks lapping one upon another

bezel.definition: The rim which encompasses and fastens a jewel or other object, as the crystal of a watch, in the cavity in which it is set

bezique.definition: A game at cards in which various combinations of cards in the hand, when declared, score points

Hence: Any antidote or panacea
